meanings.definition: To make a soft rustling sound.
meanings.sent1: The leaves brize in the wind.
meanings.sent2: I love to hear the trees brize on a calm day.
meanings.sent3: The paper brized loudly as I crumpled it up.
meanings.sent4: The curtains brized like whispers in the night.
meanings.sent5: The fabric brized gently as she moved it.

meanings.sent1: The brize felt cool on my face.
meanings.sent2: We enjoyed the brize during our picnic.
meanings.sent3: The brize carried the scent of flowers to us.
meanings.sent4: The brize danced through the trees like a playful child.
meanings.sent5: The brize ruffled the feathers of the birds.

meanings.sent1: The constant tapping on the table began to brize me.
meanings.sent2: Please stop trying to brize me with your jokes.
meanings.sent3: His teasing tone seemed to brize her more than usual.
meanings.sent4: The buzzing mosquito continued to brize me all night.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive sound started to brize my nerves.
